verses.verse: I <WH589> said <WH559> in mine heart, <WH3820> Go to <WH1980> now, <WH4994> I will prove <WH5254> thee with mirth, <WH8057> therefore enjoy <WH7200> pleasure: <WH2896> and, behold, <WH2009> this <WH1931> also <WH1571> is vanity. <WH1892>
I said <WH559> of laughter, <WH7814> It is mad: <WH1984> and of mirth, <WH8057> What <WH4100> doeth <WH6213> it? <WH2090>

I sought <WH8446> in mine heart <WH3820> to give <WH4900> <WH853> myself <WH1320> unto wine, <WH3196> yet acquainting <WH5090> mine heart <WH3820> with wisdom; <WH2451> and to lay hold <WH270> on folly, <WH5531> till <WH5704> <WH834> I might see <WH7200> what <WH335> was that <WH2088> good <WH2896> for the sons <WH1121> of men, <WH120> which <WH834> they should do <WH6213> under <WH8478> the heaven <WH8064> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of their life. <WH2416>
I made me great <WH1431> works; <WH4639> I built <WH1129> me houses; <WH1004> I planted <WH5193> me vineyards: <WH3754>
I made <WH6213> me gardens <WH1593> and orchards, <WH6508> and I planted <WH5193> trees <WH6086> in them of all <WH3605> kind of fruits: <WH6529>
I made <WH6213> me pools <WH1295> of water, <WH4325> to water <WH8248> therewith <WH4480> the wood <WH3293> that bringeth forth <WH6779> trees: <WH6086>

I got <WH7069> me servants <WH5650> and maidens, <WH8198> and had <WH1961> servants born <WH1121> in my house; <WH1004> also <WH1571> I had <WH1961> great <WH7235> possessions <WH4735> of great <WH1241> and small cattle <WH6629> above all <WH4480> <WH3605> that were <WH7945> <WH1961> in Jerusalem <WH3389> before <WH6440> me:

I gathered <WH3664> me also <WH1571> silver <WH3701> and gold, <WH2091> and the peculiar treasure <WH5459> of kings <WH4428> and of the provinces: <WH4082> I got <WH6213> me men singers <WH7891> and women singers, <WH7891> and the delights <WH8588> of the sons <WH1121> of men, <WH120> as musical instruments, <WH7705> <WH7705> and that of all sorts.

So I was great, <WH1431> and increased more <WH3254> than all <WH4480> <WH3605> that were <WH7945> <WH1961> before <WH6440> me in Jerusalem: <WH3389> also <WH637> my wisdom <WH2451> remained <WH5975> with me.

And whatsoever <WH3605> <WH834> mine eyes <WH5869> desired <WH7592> I kept <WH680> not <WH3808> from <WH4480> them, I withheld <WH4513> not <WH3808> <WH853> my heart <WH3820> from any <WH4480> <WH3605> joy; <WH8057> for <WH3588> my heart <WH3820> rejoiced <WH8056> in all <WH4480> <WH3605> my labor: <WH5999> and this <WH2088> was <WH1961> my portion <WH2506> of all <WH4480> <WH3605> my labor. <WH5999>

Then I <WH589> looked <WH6437> on all <WH3605> the works <WH4639> that my hands had wrought, <WH7945> <WH6213> <WH3027> and on the labor <WH5999> that I had labored <WH7945> <WH5998> to do: <WH6213> and, behold, <WH2009> all <WH3605> was vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit, <WH7307> and there was no <WH369> profit <WH3504> under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121>

And I <WH589> turned <WH6437> myself to behold <WH7200> wisdom, <WH2451> and madness, <WH1947> and folly: <WH5531> for <WH3588> what <WH4100> can the man <WH120> do that cometh <WH7945> <WH935> after <WH310> the king? <WH4428> even <WH853> that which <WH834> hath been already <WH3528> done. <WH6213>
Then I <WH589> saw <WH7200> that <WH7945> <WH3426> wisdom <WH2451> excelleth <WH3504> folly, <WH4480> <WH5531> as far as light <WH216> excelleth <WH3504> darkness. <WH4480> <WH2822>

The wise man's <WH2450> eyes <WH5869> are in his head; <WH7218> but the fool <WH3684> walketh <WH1980> in darkness: <WH2822> and I myself <WH589> perceived <WH3045> also <WH1571> that one event <WH7945> <WH4745> <WH259> happeneth <WH7136> to <WH854> them all. <WH3605>

Then said <WH559> I <WH589> in my heart, <WH3820> As it happeneth <WH4745> to the fool, <WH3684> so it happeneth <WH7136> even <WH1571> to me; and why <WH4100> was I <WH589> then <WH227> more <WH3148> wise? <WH2449> Then I said <WH1696> in my heart, <WH3820> that this <WH2088> also <WH7945> <WH1571> is vanity. <WH1892>

For <WH3588> there is no <WH369> remembrance <WH2146> of the wise <WH2450> more than <WH5973> of the fool <WH3684> forever; <WH5769> seeing that which now <WH7945> <WH3528> is in the days <WH3117> to come <WH935> shall all <WH3605> be forgotten. <WH7911> And how <WH349> dieth <WH4191> the wise <WH2450> man? as <WH5973> the fool. <WH3684>

Therefore I hated <WH8130> <WH853> life; <WH2416> because <WH3588> the work <WH4639> that is wrought <WH7945> <WH6213> under <WH8478> the sun <WH8121> is grievous <WH7451> unto <WH5921> me: for <WH3588> all <WH3605> is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit. <WH7307>

Yea, I <WH589> hated <WH8130> <WH853> all <WH3605> my labor <WH5999> which I <WH7945> <WH589> had taken <WH6001> under <WH8478> the sun: <WH8121> because I should leave <WH7945> <WH5117> it unto the man <WH120> that shall be <WH7945> <WH1961> after <WH310> me.

And who <WH4310> knoweth <WH3045> whether he shall be <WH1961> a wise <WH2450> man or <WH176> a fool? <WH5530> yet shall he have rule <WH7980> over all <WH3605> my labor <WH5999> wherein I have labored, <WH7945> <WH5998> and wherein I have showed myself wise <WH7945> <WH2449> under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121> This <WH2088> is also <WH1571> vanity. <WH1892>

Therefore I <WH589> went about <WH5437> to cause <WH853> my heart <WH3820> to despair <WH2976> of <WH5921> all <WH3605> the labor <WH5999> which I took <WH7945> <WH5998> under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121>

For <WH3588> there is <WH3426> a man <WH120> whose labor <WH7945> <WH5999> is in wisdom, <WH2451> and in knowledge, <WH1847> and in equity; <WH3788> yet to a man <WH120> that hath not <WH7945> <WH3808> labored <WH5998> therein shall he leave <WH5414> it for his portion. <WH2506> This <WH2088> also <WH1571> is vanity <WH1892> and a great <WH7227> evil. <WH7451>

For <WH3588> what <WH4100> hath <WH1933> man <WH120> of all <WH3605> his labor, <WH5999> and of the vexation <WH7475> of his heart, <WH3820> wherein he <WH7945> <WH1931> hath labored <WH6001> under <WH8478> the sun? <WH8121>

For <WH3588> all <WH3605> his days <WH3117> are sorrows, <WH4341> and his travail <WH6045> grief; <WH3708> yea, <WH1571> his heart <WH3820> taketh not <WH3808> rest <WH7901> in the night. <WH3915> This <WH2088> is also <WH1571> vanity. <WH1892>

There is nothing <WH369> better <WH2896> for a man, <WH120> than that he should eat <WH7945> <WH398> and drink, <WH8354> and that he should make his soul <WH7200> <WH853> <WH5315> good <WH2896> in his labor. <WH5999> This <WH2090> also <WH1571> I <WH589> saw, <WH7200> that <WH3588> it <WH1931> was from the hand <WH4480> <WH3027> of God. <WH430>
For <WH3588> who <WH4310> can eat, <WH398> or who <WH4310> else can hasten <WH2363> hereunto, more <WH2351> than <WH4480> I?

For <WH3588> God giveth <WH5414> to a man <WH120> that is good <WH7945> <WH2896> in his sight <WH6440> wisdom, <WH2451> and knowledge, <WH1847> and joy: <WH8057> but to the sinner <WH2398> he giveth <WH5414> travail, <WH6045> to gather <WH622> and to heap up, <WH3664> that he may give <WH5414> to him that is good <WH2896> before <WH6440> God. <WH430> This <WH2088> also <WH1571> is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit. <WH7307>
